attributes.action: establish a working party to produce clearer guidance to British Muslims as to how the Koran should be interpreted and practised within 21st Century Britain
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This petition calls on the Prime Minister to arrange for the establishment of a working party, to include Muslim Clerics and Muslim community representatives, to produce guidance for those who follow Islam in the UK as to how the Koran should be interpreted and practised in 21st Century Britain. 

This working party within its terms of reference should have regard to our traditional UK culture and confirm that our legal system does not recognise Sharia Law, enforced marriages, sexual discrimination, nor honour ‘punishments,’ each of which is totally alien to the British Rule of Law and the definition of ‘acceptable behaviour’ within the UK in the 21st Century.

This will ensure that there are no excuses offered for any misinterpretation by radical Muslims and thereby aid the majority of Muslims who are moderate to be just that, moderate, tolerant and understanding of their fellow inhabitants of this small island, regardless of their religious belief, or not, as the case may be.
